poem:
**Security Line**

At Heathrow  
the clear plastic bag  
goes limp

shampoo, a small river  
no longer measured  
in thimbles

laptops sleep  
inside the dark fabric  
of carry-ons

a new eye  
turns the world  
in slices

and still  
we line up,  
hands empty,  
thinking of 2006.

The restrictions have been in place since 2006 when the maximum size for liquids, pastes and gels in hand baggage was first introduced, after a foiled transatlantic bomb plot.
